text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Jordanian press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- A Palestinian girl shoots Israelis after crossing into the Israeli occupied West Bank from Jordan; sources say she acted in revenge for the killing of her brother in an Israeli prison in 1988.
- Crown Prince Hassan inspects the new Justice Palace complex; stresses the importance of the independance of the judiciary.

- Prime Minister Abdul Salam al-Majali says will set up a new ministerial committee to study unifying benefits of public sector employees; the issue has been a bone of contention between unionists and the government.
- An official source says the interrogation still underway by the military prosecutor handling the case of the imprisoned Jordanian soldier who shot the Israeli schoolgirl last March.
- Why hasn't the U.N. compensation money for Jordanian victims of the Iraqi invasion of Kuwait arrive yet?
- Majali expected to meet parliamentary deputies on Monday to continue consultations on domestic issues in run up to national elections next Novemeber.
- Arrest of illegal arms smugglers by the border police.
- Saudi King Fahd congratulates King Hussein on his successful prostate surgery.
